news_header: Chancellor Rachel Reeves announced tax increases and new spending commitments in Labour's first Budget in 14 years, impacting various financial aspects for individuals and businesses.
news_text: Chancellor Rachel Reeves presented Labour's first Budget in 14 years, introducing tax rises and new spending commitments. Key changes include an increase in stamp duty for second homes, a rise in National Insurance for businesses, and adjustments to pension inheritance rules. The cap on bus fares will also increase, while the interest rates are expected to fall but not as quickly as previously predicted. The Budget aims to support first-time buyers and address cost-of-living concerns.
